[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Struct: AltFr] [Comparison] Does AltFr implement Eq/PartialEq correctly, or could equality comparison errors cause validators to disagree on hash outputs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Struct: AltFr] [Hash trait] If AltFr is used in HashMap/HashSet, does its Hash implementation correctly account for field element equivalence (canonical representation)? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Struct: AltFr] [Field order] Is the modulus '21888242871839275222246405745257275088548364400416034343698204186575808495617' actually prime, or could composite modulus break field arithmetic security? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Struct: AltFr] [Subgroup attacks] Does BN254's scalar field have small subgroups that could be exploited via AltFr operations to break discrete log assumptions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Struct: AltFr] [Twist attacks] Could incorrect field arithmetic in AltFr enable twist attacks on BN254 elliptic curve operations used elsewhere in Aptos? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Struct: AltFr] [Weak RNG] If AltFr::random() exists and uses weak randomness, could predictable field elements compromise Poseidon-based commitments? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Function: From<&str>] [DoS via parsing] Could an attacker provide extremely long hex strings to from_str_vartime causing excessive CPU usage and DoS? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Function: From<ark_bn254::Fr>] [DoS via conversion] Are there pathological ark_bn254::Fr values that cause extremely slow AltFr conversion, enabling computation DoS? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Struct: AltFr] [Expensive operations] Do certain field arithmetic operations (inversion, sqrt) have worst-case complexity that could be exploited for DoS? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Integration: keyless] If AltFr conversions are used to hash JWT claims, could conversion errors allow authentication bypass by manipulating field element representations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Integration: keyless] When packing bytes to scalars and converting to AltFr, could endianness errors cause different hash outputs between on-chain and off-chain verification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Integration: keyless] Could an attacker craft malicious JWT payloads that exploit AltFr conversion edge cases to forge valid Groth16 proofs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Integration: keyless] If Poseidon hash outputs (using AltFr) don't match circuit-computed hashes due to field representation differences, could this break keyless account security? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Function: From<ark_bn254::Fr>] [Side channel] Does from_repr_vartime leak timing information about the input field element that could be exploited in side-channel attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Function: From<&str>] [Side channel] Does from_str_vartime have timing variations based on hex string value that could leak sensitive data? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Struct: AltFr] [Constant time] Are all field arithmetic operations in AltFr implemented in constant time, or could timing attacks recover private scalars? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Type safety] Could developers accidentally mix AltFr with raw [u64; 4] arrays, bypassing field arithmetic and creating invalid field elements? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Type safety] Is there proper type safety to prevent mixing AltFr (for BN254) with field elements from other curves (e.g., BLS12-381)? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Type confusion] Could AltFr values be unsafely cast to/from other types, bypassing modular reduction and creating out-of-range field elements? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Fuzzing] Has AltFr been fuzz-tested with random ark_bn254::Fr values to detect conversion edge cases that could break Poseidon? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/poseidon_bn254/alt_fr.rs] [Cross-validation] Have Poseidon hashes computed using AltFr been cross-validated against reference implementations to detect field arithmetic bugs? (Critical)
